args: Is there no end to these fiends?!
If this battle drags on much longer,\nI fear exhaustion will win the day.\nWe must end it quickly!
Uh oh. Is there something on my face?
My apologies. I did not mean to stare.
I simply cannot help but be fascinated\nevery time I see you shapeshift.
It reminds me of the Manaketes—a race\nof dragon-people from my world who\npossess a similar power.
So your world also has dragons?
They have the ability to seal away their\ndraconic power and assume human form.
It is much like your shapeshifting,\nexcept in reverse.
I think we just found another\nunexpected similarity.
Might you tell me a little more\nabout shapeshifting?
It looks to me like a power which allows\nhumans to become dragons, no?
It's a bit more complicated than that.\nShapeshifting is a power born from\nthe trust between a human and a dragon.
It's an ability passed down through the\ndragonblood of the Alberian royal family.
With it, we can form pacts with dragons\nand receive their assistance.
So humans and dragons live in harmony\nhere in Alberia?
Er, for the most part, yes.\nIs that not the case in your world?
No. My sworn enemy was a Manakete.
He was the emperor of a dragon tribe\nthat tried to rule over humanity.

Not all Manaketes are my enemies, 
of course—some even lent me their
strength. But I fear a great many
stood against me as well.
So you understand why I find the concept\nof humans and dragons coexisting to be\na bit... Well, strange.

It also makes me question some of my
past actions. I fought dragons to return
peace to the kingdom, but now I wonder
if there was perhaps another path.
I'm sure you were only doing\nwhat you thought was right.
If something similar was to happen in\nAlberia, I would fight whoever I had to\nin order to save it.
People who live in shackles\nwill never know happiness.
Dragons may be revered in my world,\nbut that doesn't mean there will never\nbe an evil one.
So I will fight them if I have to,\nand I will right whatever wrongs\nthey may end up committing.
That is the duty of all who carry\nthe dragon bloodline.
Your words have the ring of truth.
If anyone deserves the title of Hero-King,\nit is clearly you.
Oh, believe me, I have more than\nmy own share of problems.
My friends are always telling me I'm\ntoo soft, for one.
Ha ha! A flaw I share.
I was always being told that one needs\nmore than ideals and pleasantries to\nwin a fight.
I once got in a great deal of trouble\nfor acting as a decoy because I didn't\nwant to force that burden on a friend.
And I'm always being told that I\nfight far too close to the front lines\nfor a prince and commander.
Still, if something can be done to reduce\nthe number of casualties in battle,\nwhy would you not do it?
And not just friends—I have no desire\nto see blood spilled on either side.
I'm actually sort of relieved to hear\nsomeone else say that.
It backs up my own feelings.
Kindness is a strength to be celebrated.
Say, do you have any more stories about\nyou and your friends that you'd be willing\nto share?
Countless—so I hope you know what you\nare getting into by asking.
Sit down, Prince. Take your ease.\nThis should only take...oh, three or\nfour months at the most.
